info.game_comments:
1997 Power Players Week game 3.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

(2, 1).clue: An 1873 law requires that this Latin motto appear on one side of every U.S. coin

(4, 1).clue: In April 1994 this Charles replaced Charles Kuralt on CBS News Sunday Morning

(5, 1).clue: "Tom Sawyer" author who said, "There is no distincly Native American criminal class, except Congress"

(6, 1).clue: This small stream, 30 miles from where we now stand, was the site of 2 Civil War battles

(2, 2).clue: This agency, the GAO, advises Congress on the use of public funds

(4, 2).clue: The Crystal Cathedral is the setting of this reverend's "Hour of Power"

(5, 2).clue: Louisiana "Kingfish" who reportedly said, "The time has come for all good men to rise above principle"

(6, 2).clue: Garry Trudeau based this comic strip on "Bull Tales", a strip he created while attending Yale

(2, 3).clue: An amendment becomes part of the Constitution after this many states have ratified it

(4, 3).clue: His name no longer appears in the title of ABC's "This Week"

(5, 3).clue: Famous politician heard here on Sept. 23, 1952:"The kids, like all kids, love the dog and I just want to say this right now that regardless of what they say about it, we're going to keep him..."

(6, 3).clue: In about 1867 he was made principal chief of several Sioux tribes

(2, 4).clue: This Treasury Department agency, the ATF, investigates hitmen & mad bombers
(2, 4).correct response: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms

(4, 4).clue: This show is based in Washington, D.C where host Tim Russert is NBC's bureau chief

(5, 4).clue: Rope-spinning humorist who said, "I am not a member of any organized party; I am a Democrat"

(6, 4).clue: This 1980 Robert De Niro film is in black & white except for the credits & home movies of Jake La Motta

(2, 5).clue: Most presidential libraries are controlled by this agency which maintains our government records

(4, 5).clue: Now appearing together on CNN, these 2 journalists first teamed up for a newspaper column in 1963

(5, 5).clue: He said, "I never give them hell; I just give them the truth and they think it is hell"

(6, 5).clue: The crowd noises from this first Herb Alpert hit were dubbed from a bullring in Tijuana

(1, 1).clue: In 1950 Sen. Margaret Chase Smith condemned this man for turning the Senate into a "forum for hate"

(2, 1).clue: Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald & schoolmates talk through day-long detention in this film

(5, 1).clue: 1/60 of a minute, until 1960 it was defined as 1/86,400th of a mean solar day

(1, 2).clue: In 1989 she was awarded the Presidential Medal of this

(2, 2).clue: This 1959 film based on a journal written during WWII is set largely in an attic

(4, 2).clue: Bob Dole was wounded in the right shoulder in WWII & this Hawaiian senator lost his right arm

(5, 2).clue: Plant from which Eli Whitney's gin removed seeds

(6, 2).clue: Pre-U.S. Congress, or a style of Lincoln(11)

(1, 3).clue: The first woman elected to both houses, she represented this state for 32 years

(5, 3).clue: This oxygen producing process in plants takes place only during daylight

(1, 4).clue: In 1961 this world leader called pro-nuclear Margaret "The devil in the disguise of a woman"

(5, 4).clue: The word vaccination comes from "vacca", meaning this animal whose pox germs were used

(1, 5).clue: Jiminy Cricket!  Her 1972 book was "Declaration of" this

(4, 5).clue: His peak as an orator came in an 1830 reply to a speech by Bob Hayne, a South Carolina senator

(0, 0).clue: In 1832 when the House tried Sam Houston for contempt, he was defended by this lawyer & lyricist
